education.thesis: Mechanistic Control of Tempo and Function in Gene Regulation via Quantitative Modelling

education.institution: University of Cambridge, Murray Edwards College

courses: A-level: Maths A*, Further Maths A*, Physics A*

work.name: Kyoto University
work.summary: Working on species-specific tempo of brain development.

work.name: Imperial College London
work.summary: Investigating how evolutionarily conserved gene regulatory programs control developmental tempo across species using dynamical-systems-based mathematical simulations and analysis of experimental data. Also explore control and noise robustness of synthetic circuits.

work.name: University of Cambridge, Department of Genetics
work.summary: Used live imaging data and mathematical modelling to study vertebrate axial elongation in zebrafish embryos. Collaboration with Dr Ben Steventon and Dr Berta Verd. Awarded best research project in cohort and continued as summer intern.

work.name: EMBL-EBI (Goldman Group), Hinxton
work.summary: Implemented computational simulations to test mathematical models improving efficiency of nanopore sequencing.

awards.title: Short-term Postdoctoral Fellowship
awards.awarder: Japan Society for the Promotion of Science
awards.summary: ¥1,010,000 + flights for a research project in Kyoto using single-cell transcriptomics to investigate corticogenesis across species.

awards.title: Threlfall Fund
awards.awarder: Imperial College London, Department of Life Sciences

awards.title: Best Master’s Research Project
awards.summary: Awarded £50 prize for best research project in cohort.

awards.title: Lady Judge Morningside Award for Women

projects.name: INTERPHACE Symposium
projects.summary: Organising an interdisciplinary symposium bridging theoreticians and experimentalists at the Francis Crick Institute (24 Feb 2025).

projects.name: Mathematical Life Sciences Group
projects.summary: Founded a departmental group at Imperial to encourage collaboration in mathematical life sciences, hosting monthly seminars and socials.

publications.name: A mathematical framework for measuring and tuning tempo in developmental gene regulatory networks
Dynamic, adaptive sampling during nanopore sequencing using Bayesian experimental design
publications.summary: Weilguny L., De Maio N., Munro R., Manser C., Birney E., Loose M., Goldman N.

speaking.name: European Conference on Mathematical and Theoretical Biology
